Transcript: Harley: I'm so happy you picked up the phone.
Gus: Yeah. What's the matter? You couldn't sleep?

Harley: Are you kidding me? Nobody hogging the covers, nobody tossing and 
turning, nobody kicking me in his sleep.

Gus: What's the matter? You miss somebody taking up three-quarters of the 
bed.
Harley: I never want to go to sleep or wake up without you again.

Gus: Baby, in a few more hours, that won't ever be a problem again. Are you 
ready?
Harley: Um, yeah. Yeah, pretty much. Just a few last-minute touches. You?

Gus: Oh, yeah, I'm ready. Are you kidding me? I was born ready for this 
thing. So, why don't you hurry up over here and we'll do this thing, you know, 
so we can get back to... get back to sleep. (Laughs)

Harley: Listen, sweetie, i know that we've had some really crazy issues with 
our families lately, but I want you to know there is nothing I would rather do 
today than marry you.

Gus: Well, that's exactly how I feel, and I don't even think you'll ever 
really know.
Blake: Talking to the groom before the wedding? It's bad luck.

Harley: Are you kidding me, this is bad luck? I thought looking at the groom 
was bad luck. Him seeing you, that's bad luck. This isn't bad luck, is it?

Blake: It's okay, it's okay. I'm just kidding. You're safe. As long as it's 
not a video phone. (Laughs)
Harley: Okay, don'T... don't mess with me. I'm a bride on the edge, here.
Blake: Aren't they all.

Marina: Don't worry. We've got it totally under control. Body shimmers, body 
bronzers.
Harley: Okay, good. Where's my dress?
Marina: Will you chill out? Reva is bringing it, okay? I'll go set up.

Blake: Here, take this. Take this. You can do it. Yeah, thanks. All right. 
Hey. Why do I get the feeling that this is more than pre-wedding jitters?

Harley: Maybe because you know me, because you know i should trust their 
instincts at all times.
Blake: About?
Harley: Alexandra. She was brad green's accomplice the whole time. I knew it!
Blake: Oh, my god. Does gus know?

Harley: No, he doesn't know yet. I'm letting him have today and then I'm 
going to drop the brick on his head.

Blake: Oh, honey, I'm so sorry. But listen, as long as gus has you, he will 
be fine. He will.
Harley: You're such a good friend.
Blake: Thank you.

Marina: Hey, you two. No crying. It'll ruin the pictures. Let's get a move 
on. We've got a wedding to go to.
Harley: Oh, my gosh, that's right, I'm getting married. (Laughs)
Blake: Yeah.
Harley: I'm getting married today. (Laughs)
Blake: Again.
Harley: Again. (Laughter)

Gus: What kind of shirt is this? It's got no buttons on it. Cufflinks. I had 
a conversation about cufflinks with alan. He was going to get me the cufflinks. 
No, I was going to get the cufflinks. I was supposed to get the cufflinks from 
alan. This is for the cufflinks, these little holes.
Phillip: Mm-hmm. He was going to get you the cufflinks.
Gus: You grew up with this. You know this stuff. I don't know this stuff.

Phillip: Yeah. But he's not bringing you cufflinks. I'm bringing you 
cufflinks.
Gus: Thank you.
Phillip: (Laughs)
Gus: Thank you.

Phillip: Here. These were our grandfather's-- your official "welcome to the 
family" gift. A little late, I know, but I've been busy.
Gus: Wow. Thank you.
Phillip: You know how to put those in?
Gus: Uh, I'll figure it out.
Phillip: Here. You set with your vows?
Gus: Yeah my vows. Well, they don't exactly say what I want harley to know.
Phillip: Mm-hmm? It's okay. She'll get the message.
Gus: I don't deserve her, phillip.

Phillip: Yeah, you do. It took you a while, but you earned her trust, and I 
don't think you'll ever let her down. Trust me, that's all harley cares about.
Gus: Thank you. Thanks.

Alexandra: Oh, my. This is a lovely picture, phillip, you helping your 
brother dress.
Alan: Is there anything we can help you guys with?

Gus: Phillip and I were just talking about trust. Any thoughts on the 
subject?
Bill: Watch it, lady.
Olivia: You watch it. It's my hotel. So? What's that? A wedding present?
Bill: This? How did you guess? (Laughter) you?
Olivia: Yeah. You actually going to this wedding?

Bill: Yeah, I thought I'd go do a little networking. I can use all the 
business connections I can get.
Dinah: Short-term parking, okay? And no dents, all right?
Valet: Are you checking in?

Dinah: That depends. Is this the hotel that's owned by olivia spaulding and 
what's- her-name?
Valet: Cassie winslow? Yes, it is.

Dinah: Good. Okay, well, I'm going to take a look around and I will let you 
know.
Marina: Grandpa, no boys allowed.

Buzz: Just passing through. Just passing through. Why don't you check out the 
spread over there? Hi, beautiful. How are you doing?
Harley: Hi, daddy. How are you?

Buzz: I, um... a little uncomfortable. Nervous about walking down the aisle. 
Fine.

Harley: No, I mean, alexandra. What happened with you guys after I left last

Buzz: What sort of question is that? Do I ask you about your sex life?
Harley: Dad!

Buzz: We danced. We talked about chili and caviar. I told her I loved her and 
she went home. Does that work for you?
Marina: The ladies' locker room is off-limits, grandpa.
Buzz: I'm going, I'm going, I'm going. Now I'm gone.
Harley: I knew she wouldn't do it.
Blake: Hair department time. Right now.

Harley: One second. Hey. I need to see you. There is something I need to take 
care of before the wedding and you're the only person who can help me do it.
Marina: Okay, the wedding dress is in the building.

Reva: Yes, and now it's time for that "something old, something borrowed, 
something blue..." old, new, blue...
Harley: Oh, my gosh. You guys did not do this.
Blake: Yes, we did.
Cassie: What kind of bridesmaids do you think we are?

Blake: That's right. We finally got you and gus together so we have to do all 
of this traditional stuff to make it stick.
Harley: You guys are so good to me. Thank you.
Cassie: Something new, from venice.
Harley: Ooh. Venice, italy? Is that why you didn't pick up your cell?
Reva: My jet-setting sister.
Cassie: Long story. Go ahead, open it.
Harley: Ooh. Jewelry. Oh, how sweet. It's a gondola. That's so sweet.
Cassie: So you and gus will have smooth sailing for the rest of your lives.
Harley: Thank you.
Marina: It's my turn. My turn. Something blue.
Harley: Oh, no. Should I be scared? (Laughter) (screams) (laughter)
Darci: You feeling okay? You didn't sleep at all last night.

Frank: Yeah, I'm fine. I just... I think I'm a little nervous for the 
wedding, that's all.
Darci: Somehow I doubt that.

Frank: Don't be worrying about me. Just go in there and have a good time with 
harley.

Darci: Come in with me. I know harley would love to see you. It might do you 
some good.

Frank: You know, I would love to, but I've got to get these rings over to the 
spauldings' because I don't want gus to think that his best man has kind of 
bailed on him. So, I'll see you.

Darci: I just can't understand how hard this must be for you: Doing all of 
this for gus while you suspect that alan and alex are the ones who framed you.

Frank: It's just one more day. One more day and I'm going to go after the 
spauldings, big time.

Darci: I just don't understand who could possibly think that you would 
protect the mob. What possible motive would you have?

Frank: Sweetheart, know what? Can we just put this on hold right now and just 
try to have a good time? Because my sister really deserves to have a big, happy 
wedding. Okay? I love you. See you.
Darci: Frankie?
Frank: Yeah?
Darci: Gus was right. You are the best man.

Alan: Trust and loyalty are the heart of this family, and no one knows better 
than gus.

Phillip: That's right. I appreciate you watching my back at spaulding while I 
was in the hospital.

Alexandra: We all appreciate your stepping in, you know. Putting your own 
career on hold, filling in for phillip in the business.
Phillip: Okay. You're a spaulding now. No turning back.
Gus: Hey, where's frank? He's supposed to be here by now.
Phillip: I don't know, but I'll go see if I can find him.

Gus: You guys are good. You got this down to a science: How to destroy a 
man's life and cover up a drug scandal all at the same time. What does it 
matter, though, right? As long as the tux is custom and the champagne is 
imported.

Alexandra: Oh, come on. Really, gus, is it so bad that we want you and harley 
to have this day?
Alan: Gus, we're trying to protect you.

Gus: No, you're not. You're trying to protect yourselves. Oh, man. I am 
having trouble looking at myself in the mirror. I need a drink. This is what 
white-collar crime feels like. Now I know. (Laughs bitterly)

Alexandra: Oh, come on, gus. You know, I'm just... I'm a little sick and 
tired of this righteous indignation. You are in this as much as I am and no one 
forced you to take the family's side in this mess. No one forced you. (Arguing)

Gus: I don't remember ever having a conversation with you about framing frank 
cooper. I don't remember that!
Alan: Alexandra, please. He's under a lot of pressure.

Alexandra: No! We're going to get this straight right now. Now, what's it 
going to be, gus?

Gus: What if there's another way? What if there's a way to protect frank and 
to protect us at the same time?
Alan: Wait. Is that possible?
Gus: Maybe. I can't believe I didn't think of this before.
Dinah: Well, well, well. Welcome to cassieland.
Concierge: Good morning. May I help you?

Dinah: Oh, I'm just admiring this stunning old building. Somebody did a 
fabulous restoration. Who was the architect?
Concierge: You'd have to ask the owners.
Dinah: Are they here?
Concierge: Right over there. Olivia spencer spaulding.
Dinah: Bill.
Concierge: You know mr. Lewis?
Dinah: Thank you for your help. I need to run. I need to meet someone.
Bill: So, you know, I was thinking. You know, you've been married a lot.
Olivia: Have I?
Bill: Yeah. Have you ever married for love?
Olivia: I thought I did.
Bill: Yeah. See, now, they all say that, don't they?
Olivia: Well, I mean, you and eden were the real thing, right?
Bill: Well, real thing or not, I'm sure marriage would have killed that.
Olivia: I thought I was cynical.
Bill: No, numbers don't lie. Two out of three marriages end in divorce.
Olivia: I guess youon't hold out much hope forus and harley.

Bill: Gus and harley, well, i don't know. They may have a shot and I'll keep

Olivia: See, like it or not, there is hope for you yet. (Cell phone rings) 
hello?

Phillip: So, tell me. Is bill going to start this new company with tony

Olivia: Hello? You know, I think we have a bad connection.

Phillip: (Laughs) olivia, don't even think about starting to play games

Harley: Oh, blake. These are beautiful.

Blake: These are for something old. They belonged to my mother and she wanted

Harley: I love them. Holly is so sweet. I love you guys. Thank you.

Blake: I love you, too, honey. I do. And I am so glad to be here, you have no

what ross had to do to frank.
Harley: Oh, please. Ross was just doing his job.
Marina: Maybe danny should have been mayor.
Harley: Marina.

Marina: Well, if he was, I'm sure none of this would be happening. I mean, 
it's all a set-up. My dad has a swiss bank account? Are you kidding me? Have you

Cassie: The truth is going to come out, marina. We all know that.

Blake: Trust me, ross knows more than anyone how a man can do something wrong 
in order to protect the woman that he loves.
Marina: My dad would never commit a crime. Never. Not even to protect darci.
Buzz: Phillip.
Phillip: Buzz.

Buzz: Big day for the spauldin and the coopers, huh? I mean, thrown together

Phillip: When are you and alex going to make it official?
Buzz: You're kidding. Well, if it ain't broke, don't fix it.
Phillip: Hm, good point. She does seem to be very happy with you. Go figure.
Frank: What is that supposed to mean?
Phillip: I was just making conversation, frank.
Frank: Oh, I see. Well, you've never been a fan of our family. So, anyway...

Phillip: Hey, frank? I know that you're under a lot of stress right now, but

okay? Your sister's wedding day? Happy? Okay. (Sighs) gentlemen, I'll see you

Frank: That guy is unbelievable.

Buzz: Frank, you know, you can't put on the gloves every time a spaulding

Frank: I understand that, pop. Okay? I know that. I promise you I won't-- I

everything. He really does. That guy went to bat for me. He didn't bail on me 
when I got suspended, he didn't let me step down as his best man, so I'll do

Gus: Actually, it's you who always had my back, frank. I owe you.

Frank: Look, gus, I just... i just want you to be good to my sister. Keep her

Gus: I'll do a lot more than that. Will you take care of him, please? Make

Buzz: Where are you going?
Gus: I'm just going to wipe the slate clean.
Marina: I am so sorry, darci. I was just sounding off.
Darci: It's okay.

Harley: And blake was just explaining why ross would never judge frank, 
because he...
Darci: I heard.

Cassie: None of us believe that frank would collaborate with the mob or 
salerno, for whatever reason.
Reva: Frank did tell you why they suspect him, didn't he?
Darci: It was because of me.

Harley: Oh, good. So he told you. I mean, I just say that because he said 
that he didn't want to tell you and I think it's good that he did.
Blake: Sit down.
Darci: It was because of me. That's what they think.

Reva: Well, you know what? It doesn't matter what they think. Nothing in your

Darci: Yeah, but that won't stop them from using what I know about the mob

Harley: Anybody who is stupid enough to go against you and frank is going to

Marina: (Cheers) (applauds)

Cassie: Well, speaking of weddings, there's not going to be one if we don't

Blake: All right.
Marina: Come on!
Blake: You know what? We have to do something borrowed.
Darci: I've got it.
Harley: No. I can't take that. Frank gave that to you.

Darci: And I love this more than anything in the world. But I think frank

Reva: Okay, enough with the traditions. Can we please get into hair and

Harley: You are so bossy.
Reva: Just noticing that?
Marina: So, where's your dress?
Darci: I was in a rush. I left it outside.
Reva: No, let me get it.
Darci: No. You stay here with harley. I'm fine.
Harley: You know what? Maybe I should go outside and help her.
Reva: No. You need to stay here and focus. You are the bride. She'll be fine.
Harley: Frank is very lucky to have her. She loves him very much.

Blake: Unless you want to get married in your jeans and your t-shirt, stay

Darci: Oh, frank. I did this to you. And you didn't say a thing.
Frank: Gus is up to something. I should have gone with him.
Buzz: Head's up.
Alan: Well, buzz, frank. I had no idea you two were here already.
Alexandra: Has anyone seen gus?
Buzz: You just missed him.
Alan: Really? Well, where did he go?
Buzz: Didn't say. You still up for tying this?
Alexandra: I promised i would, yes, yes. So, what, gus just left, huh?
Frank: Yes. Yes, he did.
Alan: Well, maybe he just left the rings somewhere or something. You think?

Frank: Uh, no, because I have the rings right here and they haven't left my 
sight. Unlike my briefcase, where that file just kind of magically appeared.
Buzz: (Grunts) I've got to breathe.
Alexandra: I'm sorry. There. There.
Buzz: Thanks. I think.

Alexandra: Anyone have any idea where gus and harley are going to go on their

Frank: No, but once they're safely on their way, I will definitely be going

clear my name.
Alexandra: I'm sure you will.

Alan: You know, I would like to make a toast to both of our families, to new

Alexandra: Really? A toast before the ceremony? A little ahead of ourselves.

Alan: I haven't tried this champagne out, alexandra, and i want to make sure

live a very happy and long life together.
Buzz: Here, here.
Alan: Here, here.
Buzz: (Gags) it tastes like window cleaner.
Alan: Oh, my gosh. It's turned to vinegar.
Alan: I hope this isn't a bad omen.

Gus: Okay, thank you. Just... you give me a minute and then you bring him in, 
okay?
Cop: You're getting married today. Can't this wait?

Gus: It's all right. I just have a little detail to clear up with him. Thank

vinnie. Long time no see.
Reva: Okay. I can't find darci and I can't find her dress.

Marina: Well, she's been so worked up about my dad, maybe she left the dress

Cassie: I'm sure she'll be here by the time we pack up to leave.
Jeffrey: Hello, everybody.
Marina: We are closed for business.

Jeffrey: No, no, no. It's okay. I have a personal invite. I'm judging the

Harley: It's okay. He's not staying. Ow.
Jeffrey: I give you very high marks for talent and bikinis.
Harley: He's not staying!
Jeffrey: I'm not staying. I'm going.
Harley: Be right back.

Jeffrey: Oh, is this the what's new in bridal attire? That's very nice. I

Harley: Shut up. Listen. For serious. I need you to do something for me.
Jeffrey: What? As da?
Harley: Yeah.
Jeffrey: Now? Today?
Harley: If you don't do it today, there won't be a wedding.
Coming up on "guiding
light"...

Alexandra: He'll be here. He's not going to skip out on his own wedding. I'm 
more concerned about frank, as a matter of fact. He should be back from the 
beacon by now.
Frank: Oh, my god. Gus, how the hell could you have done that to harley?

Harley: I have information that could change everything-- for me, for gus, 
for frank. The spauldings...

Jeffrey: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. This information that you have 
that's so important, is it really essential that we deal with it today? The day

Harley: Yes! No. I'm not sure.

Jeffrey: You're not sure. Okay, you're not sure means no, okay? And that 
means it can wait, and it's going to wait until... well, until you receive my 
present.
Harley: You weren't even invited to my wedding and you're giving me money?
Jeffrey: No, no. Don't worry, I'm not giving you money. Nice try. Open it up.
Harley: Nice card.

Jeffrey: Two tickets to the springfield dog show. I figured you and gus can 
go there and maybe you'll find a little pooch, a terrier maybe, and every time 
you look at him, you'll think of me.

Harley: I think this might be my very favorite present. Consider yourself 
officially invited.
Jeffrey: I don't think so.
Harley: Come on. Free food, single women.

Jeffrey: Okay, if you put it that way. My other present to you is that I'm 
not going to deal with this problem of yours until after your honeymoon.
Harley: Jeffrey, you don't understand. I am withholding evidence.
Jeffrey: No, no, no. Don't say anything to me, please.
Harley: Monday morning. Monday morning.
Marina: Okay, okay you two. Break it up.
Reva: Hey.
Jeffrey: Hey. Hello.
Harley: Wish me luck. (Laughs)

Jeffrey: No, you don't lead luck. You and gus have that other "l" word going 
for you. Now, go on, get out of here.
Harley: Monday morning!
Jeffrey: Okay.
Harley: Mark it down!
Salerno: Nice monkey suit, aitoro. You moonlighting as a waiter these days?
Gus: Have a seat, vinnie.
Salerno: Right after I call my lawyer.

Gus: This isn't an interrogation. We're just going to talk. You want 
something? You want a coffee?
Salerno: You know they don't even serve espresso in this dump?
Gus: So, how are they treating you, vin?
Salerno: You amnesty international now?

Gus: Now, I don't have to tell you that there is prison and then there's 
prison. Have you ever spent any time in solitary confinement. You know, one of 
those little six-by-ten rooms?
Salerno: Sounds like my first apartment.

Gus: Not for nothing, vin. But I have enough evidence here to put you in 
solitary confinement and keep you there for a very long time.

Salerno: You've got no jurisdiction over my case. The charges against me are 
federal.

Gus: Well, let me correct you. I was federal on your case. Just ask the da. 
And as the chief of police, I've got to say murder one, that would be my 
business.
Salerno: Murder one? No, man. You're looking at the wrong guy.

Gus: No, I've got one of your meat-heads that says you're the one who made 
the order to put the hit on my sister.
Salerno: They're lying.

Gus: Really? We're talking the death penalty here in this state. You 
understand that, right? I mean, are you really willing to put your life in the 
hands of a jury?
Salerno: What's my alternative?
Gus: All you have to do is confess to framing frank cooper.
Salerno: You're crazy, man.

Gus: Confess to framing him. You confess to framing him and i will focus on 
nailing the trigger man on eden's murder instead of you. It's all right there.
Salerno: You're lying.
Gus: Take a look.
Salerno: Whoa. Whoa, whoa, whoa.Rs5 wait a minute. Who's framing who here?

Frank: Hey, gus. It's me, man. Listen, where are you? If you don't call me, 
I'm sending in the troops, all right? Where's your girlfriend?
Buzz: With alan, I think. Gus not here yet?
Frank: No, not yet.
Buzz: He'll be here. Wow. Whew.
Darci: Thanks.
Frank: You look beautiful.
Darci: Thank you.
Buzz: Uh, I'll be inside.
Frank: Wow. Now, I finally have a reason to celebrate.
Darci: Oh. I'm glad to hear you say that.
Frank: Oh, honey, I've never seen you more beautiful.
Darci: You always make me feel that I am.
Frank: Oh, hey. Hey, hey, hey. What's going on here? You're shaking, here.
Darci: I'm just, you know, nervous, I guess. The wedding party. (Laughs)
Frank: You're going to be fine. Trust me.
Alan: Have either of you seen alexandra?
Frank: No, she's not here. What? Is there something wrong with gus?

Alan: Well, it's bad enough that the groom isn't here, now i discover that 
every last bottle of the champagne has turned to vinegar.

Frank: Oh. It's tragic. It's tragic, alan. Well, you know, I guess I'll have 
to go find harley and tell her that the wedding is off, right.
Darci: Frank.
Alan: I wouldn't expect you to understand, frank.

Frank: Well, that's all right, alan. Please, please. Keep up with the 
insults. I love it.

Alan: Darci, if you see alexandra, would you tell her that I'm going to send

Darci: Of course.

Frank: Oh, no. We don't have to call jeremy. I'll do it myself. I'll go. 
Please. I can't even breathe around this place.
Alan: Well, fine, frank. I'll tell them you're on your way.
Frank: Unbelievable. Oh, honey? Come with me?
Darci: I have to stay with harley.

Frank: Oh, well, then I bet you're really going to miss me, aren't you? Huh? 
How did I get so lucky to get you, huh?

Darci: You make me happier than I have ever been in my entire life. Never 
forget that.
Frank: Oh, baby.
Olivia: So, save me a dance when you're not too busy working the room.
Bill: I'd love to, but i promised your husband no touchy- feelies.
Olivia: Oh.
Bill: Well, tell the valet to get your car.
Olivia: Okay.
Dinah: Why is it all the good-looking ones get away?
Olivia: (Laughs)
Olivia: Have we met?
Dinah: No. I'm dee. You are...?
Olivia: Olivia.
Dinah: Oh.
Olivia: Are you staying here at the hotel?

Dinah: No. I am from out of town, so I'm trying to get a feel for the place. 
This is a lovely hotel.
Olivia: Oh. Thank you.
Dinah: Do you work here?
Olivia: I'm one of the owners. I'm olivia spencer spaulding. Hi.

Dinah: Hi. Yeah. You know, I read something... your partner is princess 
cassandra winslow.
Olivia: (Laughs)

Dinah: So, I'm going to suppose that she's the window dressing and you're the 
brains behind the operation. Huh?
Olivia: Actually, it's 50-50 all the way.
Bill: Olivia!
Your car is here!
Olivia: Give me a second, will you?
Dinah: Now, he is a catch. Is that your man?
Olivia: Oh, no. I'm taken.
Dinah: Too bad.

Olivia: Oh, you have no idea. Bill? Come here. There's somebody I want you to 
meet.
Bill: Now?
